issues.description: Documentation instructs to run `npm install` but the repository contains no `package.json` or dependency list; `npm start` is referenced but no `start` script exists.
issues.reproduction_result: Following the instructions as-written: `npm install` is a no-op (creates node_modules only if package.json exists); `npm start` fails because there is no package.json/start script.
issues.fix_explanation: Either include a project `package.json` with an appropriate `start` script, or update README to provide explicit, reproducible commands (examples provided in `README_fixed.md`).

issues.description: README says 'Run the service' but `input.ts` only exports `startService` and contains no top-level invocation or CLI — running the repository will not start anything.
issues.reproduction_result: Even after installing tools, executing the TypeScript file does not produce output because there is no code that calls `startService`.
issues.fix_explanation: Document that the function must be invoked (provide a `run.ts` example) or add an entrypoint to the code. The fixed README supplies a reproducible runner and commands.

issues.description: README states default `retryCount` is 1 but the code uses `config.retryCount ?? 3` (default 3).
issues.reproduction_result: Calling `startService({})` prints `Service started with retryCount=3`, contradicting the documented default of 1.
issues.fix_explanation: Update README to state the default is 3 (done in `README_fixed.md`). If the intended default is actually 1, update the code instead (not done here).

issues.description: README documents `retryCount` range as 0–10, but `input.ts` enforces 1–5 and throws for values outside that range.
issues.reproduction_result: Examples or configuration values within 6–10 or 0 will cause `startService` to throw: `Error: retryCount must be between 1 and 5`.
issues.fix_explanation: Correct the documented range to 1–5 to match the implementation (or change the code to match the documented range). The README_fixed.md aligns docs with the code.

issues.description: Example shows `startService({ retryCount: 0 })` which is outside the code's allowed range and will throw at runtime.
issues.reproduction_result: Following the example results in an exception: `Error: retryCount must be between 1 and 5`.
issues.fix_explanation: Replace the example with valid examples and show the error case explicitly (fixed README includes both valid and invalid examples and expected output/error).

issues.description: README omits required prerequisites (Node/npm, TypeScript or ts-node) and does not explain how to run the TypeScript module.
issues.reproduction_result: A new developer may attempt `node input.ts` and see a syntax error; they will not know to install `ts-node` or compile first.
issues.fix_explanation: Add explicit prerequisites and direct commands for running the TypeScript source (added to README_fixed.md).

issues.description: Example snippet is not labelled as runnable and is missing a trailing semicolon; could be clearer about where to place the code (module vs. runner).
issues.reproduction_result: No functional break, but may confuse new developers about how to execute the snippet.
issues.fix_explanation: Clarify runnable examples and add a small runner example (done in README_fixed.md).
